title: Plastic and Why it is Harmful
subtitle: Science - Class V

title: What is Plastic
content:
1. Plastic is a material made from synthetic substances.  
2. It is lightweight, flexible, and durable.  
3. Common types include polyethylene, polypropylene, and PVC.

title: How Plastic is Made
content:
1. Plastic is made from natural gas, oil, or coal.  
2. The process involves chemical reactions to create polymers.  
3. It can be molded into many shapes and forms used in products.

title: Uses of Plastic
content:
1. Plastic is used in packaging, bottles, and containers.  
2. It is found in toys, electronics, and vehicles.  
3. It plays a role in healthcare, especially in medical supplies.

title: Environmental Impact of Plastic
content:
1. Plastic is not biodegradable, taking hundreds of years to decompose.  
2. It contributes to pollution in oceans and landfills.  
3. Wildlife can get harmed by ingesting or getting tangled in plastic waste.

title: Health Risks of Plastic
content:
1. Certain chemicals in plastic can leach into food and drinks.  
2. Some plastics may disrupt human hormones.  
3. Microplastics can enter our bodies through the food chain.

title: Plastic Recycling
content:
1. Recycling can reduce plastic waste and conserve resources.  
2. Different types of plastic have different recycling processes.  
3. Recycling helps create new products but is not a complete solution.

title: Alternatives to Plastic
content:
1. Materials such as glass, metal, and paper are eco-friendly options.  
2. Biodegradable plastics made from natural materials are emerging.  
3. Using reusable bags and containers can reduce plastic consumption.

title: How to Reduce Plastic Use
content:
1. Say no to single-use plastic items like straws and bags.  
2. Choose products with less packaging.  
3. Participate in clean-up drives and support recycling initiatives.
